intro: Callitriche verna var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved spring starwort, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It typically grows in shallow water, such as ponds, ditches, and slow-moving streams. The plant has small, delicate leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. Its flowers are tiny, with four petals, and they bloom in early spring. It is a member of the Haloragaceae family and is often found in moist, nutrient-rich habitats.
